unnormalised: Bhai, that's a huge plot! 5000 sq ft is massive in Mumbai. But remember to factor in the FSI. You can't build more than what's allowed per sq meter, or the BMC will be after you. Also, check the soil. If it's weak, you'll need stronger foundations, adding to the cost per cubic meter of concrete. Best to get a good structural engineer, even if they charge extra Rs. 50000 for the design. It'll save you in the long run.
normalised: Brother, that's a huge plot! five thousand square feet is massive in Mumbai. But remember to factor in the F-S-I. You can't build more than what's allowed per square meter, or the B-M-C will be after you. Also, check the soil. If it's weak, you'll need stronger foundations, adding to the cost per cubic meter of concrete. Best to get a good structural engineer, even if they charge extra rupees fifty thousand for the design. It'll save you in the long run.
